cons: Upstate Cerebral Palsy provides services to people in need and like most companies they are working through staffing shortages and COVID impacts on the workforce.

review_title: Bad pay and even worse management.
pros: Working in the school setting you do not get mandated and get all school breaks and holidays off with pay.
cons: Horrible upper management. Only concerned about how much money they can make. Staff working on the floor get severely injured by students every day. Not even worth it for all the money in the world.

pros: They offer cash raffles when you pick up a shift

pros: It can be fulfilling your work with and make a difference in the individuals lives

pros: Fast paced and very rewarding

job_title: Resident Counselor in New Hartford, NY
pros: Good people to work with
cons: Bad management and levels of communication

pros: The biggest perk of working as a direct care professional is of course seeing the impact on the indivdual's that you work on a daily basis with. This is a kind of payment for doing your job that doesn't have a monetary value, but there is something to be said for the emotional value of it. This company does offer full-time employment to people that have little to no training or experience in this field, but only as a grunt worker. The benefits are decent and if you can handle the drama and stress, it's an okay place to work.
cons: Not nearly enough money for what you actually do, especially if you are an AMAP (Approved Medication Administration Person). Management is terrible to work with, the only thing the worry about is if the documentation is getting done so the agency gets paid. Stress is a huge concern for the direct care workers but it never seems to make it to management who just compounds the issues instead of solving them. You can get written up for just about anything if a manager doesn't like you, and you can't even call them on it because they'll just terminate you for insubordination. It's a very stressful and drama-filled work environment

review_title: Horrible would not recommend to anyone!
pros: Alright health benefits. Other than that I wouldn't recommend this place to my worse enemy!
cons: Everything. The pay for what you do and have to go through on a day to day basis is terrible. We are SEVERELY under paid, management sucks and only cares about themselves. Its the only job  I've ever worked at that you can and will get written up for just about ANYTHING they can find to do so. The turnover rate is through the roof for a reason. The pay is crap. If anyone gets abused its us workers. I spend more time working than I do with my own family and still don't make a paycheck that pays the bills. They don't like to give raises I know people who have worked here for over 5 years and still only makes a little over 10 dollars an hour! I've had concussions, have had my head split open, been punched, kicked spit on face and all and verbally abused by individuals and we don't get hazard pay or get a decent pay for that matter. This company certainly just does not care! I could go on for days with this company and their faults!

pros: The people we support
cons: I have never seen a company where there is so many clicks management wise. You go to management for actual problems that are severe just to be chastised yourself. The higher ups claim to be for the company but they are no help either. The people they make residence managers and program managers with this company clearly have no idea how to run anything. You have staff constantly late. Sleeping on overnights. Not doing their work. Always on their phones. Lazy that get more support from managers then the staff that actually work their hearts out there. From what I’ve seen the harder you work for this company the worst you’re treated. Program managers are selfish and lazy. Always making you feel bad. They don’t ever offer help to fill shifts or anything. And again the higher ups are RIDICULOUS. All very dramatic and gossip. You go to anyone , program manager, director or higher up, there is no confidentiality at all. They all gossip worse then girls in high school. I have seen staff treated so terrible and talked down to when they are doing more work then the managers and basically run the house. Managers are lazy.

review_title: If you're applying for more than a paycheck than this is a place to be.
pros: Going into work everyday did not feel like a hassle.  It was a rewarding experience.  The kids in the ICF were a lot of fun as well as challenging but it showed true character when difficult times occured on the shift.
cons: Management did not want to listen to staff in regards to certain things.  Communication is not all that great.  The pay is very little for the work that you do as a Residence Counselor.

cons: The pay is horrible for what you got to do, and put up with. The management is horrible. RC's are unapriciated and bounced around like they don't matter. And the higher up's only get involved over situations that can mess with their money.

pros: Fun, and an enjoyable work experience. Supporting and helping the individuals is the most fun on job I have ever had.
